exclusion:
Removing (Exclusion) – Z-Wave device learning mode, allowing to remove the device from existing Z-Wave network. Removing also results in resetting the device to factory defaults.

To remove the device from the Z-Wave network:

  1. Power the device.
  2. Set the main controller into remove mode (see the controller’s manual).
  3. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons.
  4. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.
  5. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.
inclusion: Adding (Inclusion) – Z-Wave device learning mode, allowing to add the device to existing Z-Wave network. i If you want to change single/double switch operating mode (see “Single/Double Switch operating mode” on page 14), you must do it before adding the device to the Z-Wave network. 5.1: Adding manually To add the device to the Z-Wave network manually: 1. Power the device. 2. Set the main controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual). 3. Quickly, three times click one of the buttons. 4. If you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box). 5. LED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end. 6. Adding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame: • Green – successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated), • Magenta – successful (Security S2 Authenticated), • Red – not successful.
label: FGWDSEU-221
overview:
FIBARO Walli Double Switch is a smart wall switch designed to control one or two light sources via Z-Wave network. It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load. You can install it with provided cover plate or other compatible. 
Main features of FIBARO Walli Double Switch: 

Can be used with:

  • Conventional incandescent and halogen light sources,
  • LED lamps,
  • Fluorescent lamps,
  • Electronic transformers (for ELV halogen lamps and LED bulbs),
  • Ferromagnetic transformers (for MLV halogen lamps).
  • Can be used with provided cover plate or one of the following:
    • GIRA – System 55 (Standard 55, E2, Event, Event Clear), 
    • Legrand – Céliane, 
    • Schneider – Odace.
    • Active power and energy consumption metering.
  • Supports Z-Wave network Security Modes: S0 with AES-128 encryption and S2 Authenticated with PRNG-based encryption. 
  • Works as Z-Wave signal repeater (all non-battery operated devices within the network will act as repeaters to increase reliability of the network). 
  • May be used with all devices certified with the Z-Wave Plus certificate and should be compatible with such devices produced by other manufacturers.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: LED frame Color ON-state
channels.overview:
This channel allows to change the color for the LED ring of the frame when the switch is in ON.
The color can be assigned as follows

0 – LED disabled
1 – White
2 – Red
3 – Green
4 – Blue
5 – Yellow
6 – Cyan
7 – Magenta
8 – colour changes smoothly depending on measured power
9 – colour changes in steps depending on measured power

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: LED frame Color OFF-state
channels.overview:
This channel allows to change the color for the LED ring of the frame when the switch is in OFF.

The color can be assigned as follows

0 – LED disabled
1 – White
2 – Red
3 – Green
4 – Blue
5 – Yellow
6 – Cyan
7 – Magenta

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: LED frame Color brightness
channels.overview:
0: LED disabled
1 - 100: 1-100% brightness
101: brightness directly proportional to measured power
102: brightness inversely proportional to measured power

options.label: remains switched off after restoring power
restores remembered state after restoring power

parameters.label: First channel – overload safety switch
parameters.overview:
This function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via button or sending a control frame. 

Single Switch Mode

0 – function disabled
10-45000 (1.0-4500.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

Double Switch Mode

0 – function disabled
10-36200 (1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

parameters.label: Second channel – overload safety switch
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode
This function allows to turn off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device can be turned back on via button or sending a control frame.

Available values 0 – function disabled
10-36200 (1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

parameters.label: LED Frame - power limit
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines maximum active power. Exceeding it results in the LED frame flashing violet. Function is active only when parameter 11 is set to 8 or 9.

Single Switch Mode
Default value 36800 (3680W)
Available values 500-36800 (50.0-3680.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

Double Switch Mode
Default value 30000 (3000W)
Available values 500-30000 (50.0-3000.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold

options.label: in steps dep on measured power

parameters.label: LED frame – colour when OFF
parameters.overview: This parameter defines the LED colour when the device is OFF.

parameters.label: LED frame – brightness
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to adjust the LED frame brightness.

Available values
0 – LED disabled
1-100 (1-100% brightness)
101 – brightness directly proportional to measured power
102 – brightness inversely proportional to measured power

parameters.label: Buttons operation
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines how device buttons should control the channels.

Single Switch Mode
Default value 1 
Available values
1 – 1st and 2nd button toggle the load
2 – 1st button turns the load ON, 2nd button turns the load OFF
3 – device works in 2-way/3-way switch configuration

Double Switch Mode
Default Value 3
Available values
1 – 1st and 2nd button toggle both channels
2 – 1st button turns both channels ON, 2nd button turns both channels OFF
3 – 1st button toggles 1st channel, 2nd button toggles 2nd channel
4 – 1st button single click turns 1st channel ON, 1st button double click turns 2nd channel ON, 2nd button single click turns both channels OFF

parameters.label: Buttons orientation
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows reversing the operation of the buttons.
Available values
0 – default (1st button controls 1st channel, 2nd button controls 2nd channel)
1 – reversed (1st button controls 2nd channel, 2nd button controls 1st channel)

parameters.label: Outputs orientation
parameters.description: Outputs orientation (Only in Double Switch Mode)
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows reversing the operation of Q1 and Q2 without changing the wiring (e.g. in case of invalid connection). Changing orientation turns both outputs off.
Available values
0 – default (Q1 - 1st channel, Q2 - 2nd channel)
1 – reversed (Q1 - 2nd channel, Q2 - 1st channel)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration - 1st slot
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.
Available values
1B [MSB] – Notification Type
2B – Notification Status
3B – Event/State Parameters
4B [LSB] – action:
 0x00 – no action
 0xX1 – turn ON
 0xX2 – turn OFF
 0xX3 – turn ON/OFF continuously
 0x0X – no action on LED frame
 0x1X – LED frame blinks red
 0x2X – LED frame blinks green
 0x4X – LED frame blinks blue
 0x8X – disable LED frame
 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.overview:

 0x8X – disable LED frame
 0xFX – LED frame LAPD signal (red-white-blue)

parameters.label: Alarm configuration – duration
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines duration of alarm sequence. When time set in this parameter elapses, alarm is cancelled, LED frame and relay restore normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.
Available values
0 – infinite
1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration

parameters.label: First button – scenes sent
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking.
Available values
1 – Key pressed 1 time
2 – Key pressed 2 times
4 – Key pressed 3 times
8 – Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: Second button – scenes sent
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent). Enabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learn mode by triple clicking. 
Available values
1 – Key pressed 1 time
2 – Key pressed 2 times
4 – Key pressed 3 times
8 – Key hold down and key released

parameters.label: Power reports – include self-consumption
parameters.overview: This parameter determines whether the power measurements for Endpoint 1 should include power consumed by the device itself.

parameters.label: Power reports for first channel – on change
parameters.description: Power reports for first channel – on change
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.
Available values
0 – reporting on change disabled
1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) – minimal change

parameters.label: Power reports for first channel – periodic
parameters.description: Power reports for first channel – periodic
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 61).
Available values
0 – periodic reports disabled
30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

parameters.label: Power reports for second channel – on change
parameters.description: Power reports for second channel – on change
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured power that results in sending new report. For loads under 50W the parameter is irrelevant, report are sent every 5W change.
Available values
0 – reporting on change disabled
1-500 (1-500%, 1% step) – minimal change

parameters.label: Power reports for second channel – periodic
parameters.description: Power reports for second channel – periodic
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter defines reporting interval for measured power. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 63).
Available values
0 – periodic reports disabled
30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

parameters.label: Energy reports for first channel – on change
parameters.description: Energy reports for first channel – on change
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.
Available values
0 – reporting on change disabled
1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change

parameters.label: Energy reports for first channel – periodic
parameters.description: Energy reports for first channel – periodic
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 65).
Available values
0 – periodic reports disabled
30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

parameters.label: Energy reports for second channel – on change
parameters.description: Energy reports for second channel – on change
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

Description This parameter defines minimal change (from the last reported) in measured energy that results in sending new report.
Available values
0 – reporting on change disabled
1-500 (0.01-5kWh, 0.01kWh step) – minimal change

parameters.label: Energy reports for second channel – periodic
parameters.description: Energy reports for second channel – periodic
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

Description This parameter defines reporting interval for measured energy. Periodic reports are independent from changes in value (parameter 67).
Available values

30-32400 (30s-9h, 1s step) – time interval

parameters.label: First channel – operating mode
parameters.overview: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel .

parameters.label: Second channel – operating mode
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2nd channel.

parameters.label: 1st ch - reaction to switch
parameters.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the button for 1st channel. The parameter is relevant only for button toggles modes (parameter 20 set to 1 or 3).

options.label: cancel mode and set default state
no reaction - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: 2nd ch - reaction to switch
parameters.description: Second channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the button for 2nd channel. The parameter is relevant only for button toggles modes (parameter 20 set to 1 or 3).

options.label: cancel mode and set default state
no reaction - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameters.label: 1st ch - time parameter for delayed
parameters.description: First channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for 1st channel (parameter 150). Delay time for switching off or duration of the pulse.
Available values
0 – 0.1 second
1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) – time parameter

parameters.label: 2nd ch - time parameter for delayed
parameters.description: Second channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for 2nd channel (parameter 151). Delay time for switching off or duration of the pulse.
Available values
0 – 0.1 second
1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) – time parameter

parameters.label: 1st ch – ON value sent to 2nd/3rd
parameters.description: First channel – Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group for manual changes of Endpoint 1 state.
Available values
0-99 or 255

parameters.label: 1st ch – OFF value sent to 2nd/3rd
parameters.description: First channel – Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group for manual changes of Endpoint 1 state.
Available values
0-99 or 255

parameters.label: 1st ch – Double Click value sent to 2nd/3rd
parameters.description: First channel – Double Click  value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group for manual changes of Endpoint 1 state.
Available values
0-99 or 255

parameters.label: 2nd ch – ON value sent to 4th/5th
parameters.description: Second channel – Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group for manual changes of Endpoint 2 state.
Available values
0-99 or 255

parameters.label: 2nd ch – OFF value sent to 4th/5th
parameters.description: Second channel – Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group for manual changes of Endpoint 2 state.
Available values
0-99 or 255

parameters.label: 2nd ch – Double Click value sent to 4th/5th
parameters.description: Second channel – Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
parameters.overview:
Only in Double Switch Mode

This parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group for manual changes of Endpoint 2 state.
Available values
0-99 or 255

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: 1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).

associations.label: ON/OFF (1)
associations.overview: 2nd association group – “On/Off (1)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation for 1st channel (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: Dimmer (1)
associations.overview: 3rd association group – “Dimmer (1)” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation for 1st channel (uses Switch Multilevel command class).

associations.label: ON/OFF (2)
associations.overview: 4th association group* – “On/Off (2)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation for 2nd channel (uses Basic command class).

associations.label: Dimmer (2)
associations.overview: 5th association group* – “Dimmer (2)” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation for 2nd channel (uses Switch Multilevel command class).
